intro: Ceterach phillipsianum, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats. The plant features a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to harsh environments, including high winds and salt spray. Ceterach phillipsianum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for native invertebrates.
